summary: This is a docket activity notice from the Second Circuit Court of Appeals regarding case 20-3061, United States v. Maxwell. It records the filing of a motion by Ghislaine Maxwell's legal team to seal a document, and includes notification details for various attorneys involved.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: She is the appellant in the case United States of America v. Maxwell, and her legal team filed a motion to seal a document on her behalf.

persons.name: Adam Mueller
persons.context: Listed as an attorney to receive electronic notice of the docket activity.

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: Listed as an attorney to receive electronic notice of the docket activity.

persons.name: Gerard Whidbee
persons.context: A Deputy Clerk for the Second Circuit Court of Appeals; notice of the filing was stored in his notice cart.

connections.description: Adam Mueller is listed as an attorney to receive notice regarding Maxwell's case, indicating he is part of her legal defense team.
Laura Menninger is listed as an attorney to receive notice regarding Maxwell's case, indicating she is part of her legal defense team.

events.title: Motion to Seal Filed in Maxwell Appeal
events.description: A motion to seal a document was filed on behalf of appellant Ghislaine Maxwell in the Second Circuit Court of Appeals (Case 20-3061).

keyFacts: On October 8, 2020, Ghislaine Maxwell's legal team filed a motion to seal a document in her appellate case (20-3061) before the Second Circuit Court of Appeals.
The docket notice identifies attorneys Adam Mueller and Laura Menninger as part of Maxwell's defense team receiving notifications.
The document is a procedural filing indicating ongoing legal activity and efforts to control public access to case materials in Maxwell's appeal.
